title: Uncertainty
verses: Proverbs 3:5-6 (WEB) — "Trust in Yahweh with all your heart, and don’t lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight."
James 1:5 (WEB) — "But if any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all liberally and without reproach; and it will be given to him."
Psalm 32:8 (WEB) — "I will instruct you and teach you in the way which you shall go. I will counsel you with my eye on you."
Isaiah 30:21 (WEB) — "When you turn to the right hand, and when you turn to the left, your ears will hear a word behind you, saying, ‘This is the way. Walk in it.’"
Psalm 37:5 (WEB) — "Commit your way to Yahweh. Trust also in him, and he will do this."
body: God guides those who surrender their understanding and ask for His wisdom. Trust is not passivity; it is a yielded heart taking the next obedient step while the Father makes the path straight. When the way is unclear, return to what is clear—His character, His Word, and the call to love.
prayer: Father, I renounce self-reliance and lean wholly on You. Speak a steady word to my heart and order my steps today. Make my path straight for the sake of Your name. Amen.
